column4: hey there... how to fix "/etc/sudoers is mode 0640, should be 0440" remote?
no idea why it says that?
i screwed w/ my sudoers file
reboot in recovery mode and chmod it back
my machine is remote... reboot into a runlevel w/ networkign?
umm, I don't think you can fix this without physical access.  Did you happen to setup a root password?
no terminal with root access right?
no, no terminal access w/ root user... i never changed the default root passwd
you shouldn't but it would be a way to avoid physical access
how to crack root passwd?... w/o sudo
you can't, there isn't one.  Just get physical access to the server
i feared... guess i'll have to get on a plane  :-(
phone call and friend is probably cheaper :)
